alert.note: Alert for Belmont; Carroll; Columbiana; Guernsey; Harrison; Jefferson; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 6:33AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT THE AREA THROUGH 715 AM EDT... At 632 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles north of Sebring to near Louisville to near New Philadelphia to 8 miles south of Newcomerstown. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wheeling, New Castle, Weirton, Steubenville, New Philadelphia, Salem, East Liverpool, Moundsville, Beaver Falls, Martins Ferry, Columbiana, Uhrichsville, St. Clairsville, East Palestine, Bellaire, Barnesville, Wellsville, Cadiz, Carrollton, and Warwood. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 189 and 225. Interstate 70 in West Virginia between mile markers 0 and 4. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 1 and 16. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 50 and 64. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 13 and 39. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM EDT for east central Ohio...western, southwestern and west central Pennsylvania...and northern West Virginia.
